intro: Hedeoma chihuahuensis, commonly known as Chihuahua hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Hedeoma chihuahuensis is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environments.
